history.content:
[Posting on behalf of Berkeley ANova]

intechquity is an online event that aims to highlight inequality within the education system and in the tech industry. As college students intending to enter the tech field, we are extremely privileged to have the opportunity to study at UC Berkeley, but it’s also important to take a step back, critique the inequalities in these industries, and discuss ways to make the field more accessible to all.

Hosted by Berkeley ANova, intechquity will take place on October 14th from 7-9 p.m. Our goal is for students to walk away from this event with more awareness about tech inequality. By addressing our own implicit biases and educating ourselves on systemic and racial barriers within the tech space, we hope to bring about more inclusivity in the classroom, at the workplace, or wherever we go.

RSVP on our Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/667059320590947/

Visit tinyurl.com/intechquity for more information.

Thank you! Hope to see you there.
history.subject: Berkeley ANova—intechquity (10/14)
